reviewText:
1 - The elephant in the room - Calling me toxic and then banning me for asking about your refusal to support windows 10 is a cowardly act.  I just wanted an answer, I cared little  about whether or not you supported it. I was concerned as to why.

You also slandered windows 10 by calling it broken and trashy on a thread you since deleted.
That is unprofessional, but what more should I expect from a person who acts like you.

The game -

1 ) Visuals - The visuals are ok, I applaud the fact that you use some of your own assets but the vast majority of the game is stock RPG maker. The parts that you, or your artist did contribute are 'meh' The drawings could be better
Each character portrait has them facing on a 3/4 angle and the eye closest to the viewer is fudged. It appears to wrap around the face from nose to ear. You dont need a mirror to see thats wrong just feel your face...eyes dont do that.

It is colorful, but the color choice is rather generic and the lighting is nothing special.


2) Gameplay - Its RPG maker and fairly bog standard at that,  *** I will acknowledge that good rpgmaker games exist but that they are also rare*** This simply isnt a diamond in the rough, it's just more 'rough'

There are some collision issues, there are sections where the sprite's *depth* is incorrect and he will appear ontop of rooves when he shouldnt.

Leaving Rome is also  weird. I can tell that you have 1 specific tile set to trigger the 'leave town' prompt
Doesnt matter what direction you face, which is something some polish would fix.



Effort - I think the artist put a fair amount of time into his or her drawings, but the game itself is weak in this department. I think this is the issue a lot of rpg maker devs have.  I am not sure why, seeing as the heavy lifting is done in rpg maker itself...


Public Relations - Lato is banning and deleting forum posts - BIG NONO
anything remotely critical is removed and labelled as toxic, I am not one to call names, so I wont, but I will call your actions what they are, Uncool and somewhat cowardly.


At this point, I will need to see some substantial upgrades to future games before I vote YES on greenlight again.

and yes I am getting my refund for 1.09

reviewText:
My full review can be found here.[www.the-backlog.net]

I Am Caligula follows the short rule of the Roman Emperor, Caligula, along with his sister, Drusilla. Within it, you'll find horrendous grammar, walls you can walk through, and unbalanced combat. Oh yeah, and there's the completely unbalanced sound design and lack of subtitles for the voice acting. The sound will go from completely blasting out your ears to having to turn up your speakers to even hear anything.

I cannot recommend I Am Caligula at all. There's no direction on where you should go next"
date: you just have to wander and hope you find the next trigger. There are missing commas everywhere
recommended: as well as there being a number of run-on sentences. No
hoursPlayed: I don't claim myself to be amazing at English
voteText: but getting a proof reader (especially if English isn't your main language) can prove vital to helping writing flow.\n\n*Note: I played this before a grammar patch was put out. I did a quick check and a number of the grammar errors I saw were still present. I didn't have time to check on the spelling errors I had found (I didn't want to deal with getting back to them through the unbalanced combat)."

reviewText:
ENGLISH:
I really liked this rpg and I really wanted to support his dev, until I found out more about him. He got a pretty bad attitude upon his customers, he outright REFUSE to solve the problems several Windows 10 users have with his game, he likes to bash Windows 10 as well, and he BAN me from the Steam Game Forums because I had written I do not wish to support him anymore! I'm always a polite person and this is the first time I'm banned on Steam. The worst part? He removed all of my comments and his bashing at W10 comments, to cover his tracks and to look innocent! This is dishonesty. I refunded my copy of I am Caligula right away and I recommend anyone not to buy from him.

Proof image of ban: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=694561570

Fortunately for you guys, I got his now deleted post about him bashing at W10 written down :  ''Windows 10 users! Do not buy the game. We all know Windows 10 is s h i t for games. If you read the req specs for the game you would see I did NOT include windows 10!
If you own Windows 10 and the game plays fine, great. If you already bought the game and Windows 10 makes it crash then refund the game, that's why the refund system is there.''

There is also this 'nice' post by the dev about W10: ''When everyone else figures out how to fix their games from Windows 10 I will be able to. I use Windows 7 like everyone else in the world that likes video games.''

As for the game, since a Steam review should be about THE GAME and not only the dev, it's a pretty generic, 90 min, RPG Maker game, with a boring storyline, few fights, and a disappointing ending.

FRENCH (FRANCAIS):
J'avais vraiment aimé ce petit rpg, et je ne comprenais pas pourquoi un groupe haineux pouvait cibler son développeur. Il semblait être un gars bien sympa et honnête. Comme je me trompais.

Il a une attitude malhonnête envers ses clients, il refuse de régler les problèmes ou bouges que des usagers ayant Windows 10 possèdent, il se moque carrément de ceux et celles ayant W10, et il m'a BANNI du forum de la communauté, tout en effaçant tous mes commentaires, parce que j'avais écrit que je n'avais pu envie de l'encourager!!! J'ai toujours été quelqu'un de poli et je n'ai JAMAIS été banni, jusqu'à présent. J'ai aussitôt demandé à être remboursée et j'encourage tout le monde à ne pas acheter de ce type.

Preuve d'avoir été bannie: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=694561570

Et pour le jeu, puis qu'il fait aussi en parler, c'est un RPG Maker de 90 min, avec une histoire ordinaire, peu de combats, et une fin décevante.

reviewText: This is a game with an interesting core concept that turned it into an impulse buy.  I was hoping for more of a story driven/managment type game was the description seems to indicate.   The story I have experienced thus far actually is interesting...the problem is with the game design and mechanics.  There is too much space to explore without direction and fun things to discover alond with unessessarily long, mazelike, and uninteresting old school RPG combat/dungeon elements.   Develeoper would have been better off reducing or eliminating combat and spend more time on story in my opinion.  For a Let's Play of the first hour or so please feel free to watch:\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wGxEVPtpKKc&feature=youtu.be

reviewText:
Well.. i was given a key of this game by the developer but like always I never let those things effect my review.

I Am Caligula follows the mad Emperor, Caligula, along with his sister, Drusilla.

Since i know a bit history and i know he didn't rule Rome for long and was mad...

This game didn't change the fact he is mad. So it ended up being a weird negative energy filled game that fast forward though this person's mad life in 96 minutes for me. You could probably blaze though it faster if u know where u going at the begining.

It's rpg maker game and It does have a level and equipment system along with items. There is even a smith to improve your main character's spear.. problem is.. you can probably finish this game in less then 20 fights that none of the usual rpg charm is untilized...

here is what i told the developer in chat.

wany1981: 1.
wany1981: pick a back story that's fun and enlighting with positive energy.
wany1981: 2.
wany1981: whether it's historical or fictional
wany1981: make sure you have enough plot and character development
wany1981: setup a story walkthough yourself
wany1981: 3.
wany1981: have a world map and have every town and city far away.. and make use of each location in plot to make them relevent.
wany1981: 4.
wany1981: voice acting is fine.. and uncommon plot such as brother love sister is fine.. just.. don't over do it
wany1981: 5.
wany1981: more planning.. more content before you release game.. u have to make sure it's ready..
wany1981: bad rep is a killer

Right now .. i cannot recommend this game at all..
3/10 would be my rating for this game. And I hope developer can improve on it to make a better game.

reviewText: I won this game in a giveaway and I have to be honest and say that if I hadn't won it, I likely would have passed by it. That being said it's only $1 and you can't even buy a cup of coffee for that anymore. This is a typical RPG maker game and it plays as such. It isn't perfect but isn't as bad as some of the other reviews are saying either. It isn't likely for everyone based on the touchy subject but also is somewhat historical. I can see from other reviews that there have been some issues between players and the developer and it is too bad this stuff has happened as I do feel the game is decent and worth a shot for people interested in the topic. I feel like the addition of playing cards and achievements would help a game like this but after having read in the discussion forums, it seems like this isn't going to happen. All I can say is that if the subject is interesting to you, why not give it a try.

reviewText:
(OOC Post and Review here. Let me say this right now. This game isn't for everyone. I Am Caligula, I played this game back on Itch and i was one of the Beta Testers for it to. I gave Lato Feedback on it and even found a Game Breaking Bug that he didn't know about to before it came to Steam. Back then, the game wasn't as good as it was now. It didn't have many of the Cut Scenes that it does now. Lato really did try his hardest with this game with adding things into it and all.

As for the story and what people are saying, it does follow Real Life events of Caligula. A lot of people are calling it an Incest Sim, but the truth is if you Google it, Caligula really did have a Relationship with his Sister. That is actual history of the Emperor. Now I'm not going to lie and say that he did add some Fantasy Elements to the Story, but he did it to flesh out the Characters and give them some back story. Read the Wiki page on Caligula and then play this game to see how Accurate it is. You'll find out a lot of the things in the game are accurate. Caligula was one of the most Insane Emperor's ever back in the Roman Empire.

As for the Graphics and Sprites, a lot of it was hand made and drawn by an Artist. A lot of work did go into that. Some of it was Default things, but not much.

The Sounds and Music really does go with what is happening during the time. Sometimes it's hard to find the right music for an area of a game, but this one flows well given the length of the game.

As for Combat, you do have to do a bit of Grinding in it before moving on to the next area. Not much, but a bit. The combat isn't that hard to go through and figure out.

As for the Navigation in the game, you just have to talk to people like in ever RPG game and Explore. It's not hard to figure out what to do next or where to go.

Bottom line is it's not a game for everyone, but i do reccomend it and for people to give it a try before bashing it. I've played my Fair Share of bad RPG Maker games and I will be completly Honest. I've played a lot worse than this. Games where no effort was put into it at all and use nothing but Default Sprites and Assestes. At least Lato did try with this game and that is something. So please, before you give it a Neg Review, at least remember the points I've laid out in this Review and try it out with an open mind.)

reviewText:
There seems to be a ton of rpg maker games on steam recently and yet each one tries to be different to another , being a rpg maker game the controls are simple you do get that run button(Shift) that saves time walking slowly everywhere and save anyime....

Back to the game I Am Caligula its a interesting take usually we see rts or city builder games to show off the romans here we have a rpg to do it , The story of calgula is certainly not pg 13 and the game does cover some of his infamous tales accurately , Wish the story was a bit longer and more mini quests.

The music is good and the cutscene + voices are a strange addition not usually seen in rpg maker games.

Hoping for some more stuff to be added to the game in the future like more story , trading cards , achievements.

For what the price of the game it is playable once .

reviewText:
=== 30 Min ===
Ok First impressions, with 30 minutes in. It can be fun, but it has a bit of a learning curve. It is reminiscent of old KOEI games of past for me. Reminds me a bit of Uncharted Waters and some might consider it similar to some of the original Zelda games. If you like these kind of games, you will probably enjoy this, if not then don't buy it you will likely be unimpressed.

The game puts you in the shoes of Caligua, 1st century Roman Emperor. If you like historical games, this might be for you too. So far though I've not seen too much in the way historicalness other than the Emperor's name, this isn't to say there isn't more.

The artwork is nice, especially on the overhead screen. It can sometimes be tempting for developers to cut corners here, in this game this not the case. The game add voice actors which can be nice for those that are kinda lazy, and don't want to read. A few of them are nice, a few others are midly annoying, but no fear you can skip over them if you like. The world is enormous, at least it seems to as I am constantly getting lost in a labrinth like city.

As of right now I recommend the game. The low price doesn't hurt either, definitely worth 5x or more what I paid for it. I'll continue to play it, and follow up later on with replayability and time to complete. Good enough for not only me, but good enough that I'll be sending a few copies out as gifts.

One thing to keep in mind. Combat mode you are on the right side of the screen not the left, this can be confusing at first. To get to full screen mode hit F5, hit it again to go back to windowed mode. If you dont do this the small screen will get distracting real fast. Spacebar allows you to talk to people.

=== 2 HRS ===
Ok 2hrs in... I'll try and keep this objective. The game starts off a little wierd and is hard to follow. I spent a good time running around trying to figure out what to do. This is kinda difficult to deal with. Once the story line starts it gets going and I found myself having fun fighting anything and everything in Germania once I got the hang of the strategy involved in combat. I could offer a few tips here but I won't, I don't want to play spoiler.

Once glaring issue is spelling and grammatical errors (watch I bet I spelled that wrong.) There are a few haters who have left reviews, I recognize one of them from a hate group that was started against the developer before the game even launched.

=== 2+ HRS ===
The game started off a bit confusing. As the game picked up I became more engaged. Again mad spelling issues. I do have a few things I'm not particularly fond of. It's hard to understand what to do next, there isn't much guidance. I did however complete the game, only took a little over 2hrs, but I'm confused as to... well... how. The game just kinda abruptly ended. There is a ton of potential here but it's missing some content. I was not a fan of the ending.
voteText: 34 of 91 people (37%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Yes. This story is based on a true story. Yes. The events are historically accurate. Yes. The game has flaws but so does every blockbuster game now a days. Personally, I have never made a game before. I am sure it is a daunting undertaking. To take such an unusually and uncomfortable story and turn it into a game takes a bit of courage.
During the time I spent with I Am Caligula, I found many things to be surprisingly lighthearted. From the smug comments to soldiers or the vendor with 'crazzzzzzy' low prices, I found a bit of humor in this game. Whether that was intentional or I am just weird, I don't know. I also enjoyed the music and the voice acting is well done.
The game is obviously an RPGMaker game. The game is limited by that alone. I feel that there needs to be more in this game. More interactions in the streets and side quests would be cool. I am not too far in the game and I may find those things. I had a platforming issue where I was stuck on a narrow path behind a NPC that would not get out of the way. While I found this annoying, I also found my self laughing and wondering if this was a way to simulate the crowed city streets of Rome. I want to feel more of that Roman atmosphere. I don't know how to do that. I am a musician, not a game developer.
Caligula is a rather taboo creature in history and to make a game about him and his lesser known sister is refreshing. Re-imagining  the familiar JRPGs of yesterday by throwing a ruthlessly insane emperor/dictator in the mix is almost post-modern. I Am Caligula is cheaper than the price of a candy bar. So why not say I am Caligula.

reviewText:
For 99 cents or less you will get at most 2-2.5 hours out of this game. The game is simple to learn and play but gives little direction on what you should be doing next. I found the world fun to explore, but was disappoitned when the major events of the story didn't impact the world. The is no real development to the characters at all.

There are a large number of glitches and errors in dialogue. The sound is overbearing but the soundtrack works for it. I've seen a lot of complaints about the combat system, but I only ever had one character die on me throughout the game, and after hitting level two found very little challenge in the combat.

This seems like a typical first try at making an RPG Maker game. That said it also feels that this was supposed to be a much larger project that got rushed and truncated.

Still with all the bad I have to recommend this dinky little game as I did enjoy my time playing it and it even made me laugh a few times, making it totally worth the 89 cents I paid for it.

reviewText:
This is a GREAT game about the history of Roman Emperor Caligula.
GREAT Lato, THANK YOU VERY MUCH for the game!!!!!
The controls are: Arrow Keys (Directions), Enter (Select), Esc (Options), F1 (GamePad), F5 (Toggle Fullscreen), F6 (Small, Medium, Large), F12 (Title Screen without warning).
It has nice BGM, awesome Artwork & funny dialogs.
Note: Armed your party well before proceeding.

Suggested Improvement for this game & maybe future games:
1) MiniMap (& maybe World Map)
2) An Arrow that points to the next task/location
3) Names on/outside Rooms, Shops & Buildings for easier navigation (& maybe NPCs’ Name on the their heads)
4) Display HP of all enemies during battle
5) Display an arrow that points to enemy when selecting an enemy during battle (or Blinking Enemy)
6) Weaker enemies at the start of the game
7) Lower MP consumption of skills
8) Practice/Grinding area/zone where player can fight weaker enemies before proceeding
9) Randomize steps for  random encounter (The Steps seem to be fixed even when Loading from Save slot)
10) WSAD Input for Directions
11) Faster walking speed
12) More Save Slots (maybe 99 Save Slots)
13) Volume balancing (& maybe upbeat Music)
14) Achievement, Trading Card & Badge

I have yet to complete the game and I will update my review when I complete it.
Currently I saved at the part where Caligula ordered Macro to burn the forest.
I am still trying to upload screenshots.
I played this on Windows 10 Home 64-bit using Integrated Graphics.
(Default GPU: Intel(R) HD Graphics Family, 2nd: NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M)
If you enjoy my review, please vote Yes & Funny.
Thank you very much everyone!

reviewText:
I Am Caligula  is a rather interesting RPG game with lot of historical elements. It talks about the life of Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus, an enigmatic character who managed to fight the powerful Roman Senate, and who attributed a series of dark events.

If you are interested in history and you fancy RPG games, give it a try. It's cheap (0,99 USD), has voices, CGs, and you will learn real history.

Recomended!
